title: New Thornmail on PBE
body:
This version builds out of a new item, called Bramble Vest.

**Bramble Vest**
Builds into Thornmail.
Total Cost: 900g.
Recipe: [Cloth Armor + Cloth Armor + G]
Stats & Effects:
+35 Armor.
Unique Passive - Thorns: Upon being hit by a basic attack, reflects 25 magic damage, inflicting Grievous Wounds on the attacker for 1 second.

And Thornmail is being made more 'core'. It's build path has changed, and now it also has Health.

Thornmail
Total cost  2900g 
Builds out of [Bramble Vest + Ruby Crystal + Warden's Mail + G]
Stats & Effects:
+250 Health
+75 Armor
Unique Passive - Thorns: Upon being hit by a basic attack, reflects magic damage equal to 10% of your bonus armor plus 25, inflicting Grievous Wounds on the attacker for 1 second. 
Unique Passive - Cold Steel: When hit by basic attacks, reduce attacker's attack speed by 15% for 1 second.

http://www.surrenderat20.net/2017/06/628-pbe-update.html

Thoughts? I'm worried it'll compete too much with Randuin's Omen, since they both sport the Cold Steel passive. I'd imagine that Tanks would just build whichever of the two is stronger at the time, although, having Grievous Wounds makes Thornmail a pretty tempting buy.

It has the smallest impact on Vlad, but it´s still stupid not being allowed to autoattack without losing the ability to heal yourself up again. But like I mentioned it has probably the least impact on him.

It could heavily impact Soraka (still less than ADCs/etc). You don´t have control over your teammates and your heals would be reduced on allies who attack someone with Thornmail. Additional the same situation like Vlad, you give up on additional damage (even if it´s not that great) for self heal (Q).

Also it hurts champions/playstyles which are based on draintanking from autoattacks -> Xin and Aatrox are such examples.

Oh my god. This is a dream.

Not overpowering on its own, but nicely updating Thornmail to be relevant and powerful. The fact that the current iteration sucks against lifesteal and true damage made me almost never find a good time to buy it, but health and REFLECTIVE GRIEVOUS WOUNDS is juicy as fuck.

It's a trap.

Let's say you're hit with a 1000 dmg auto (like a crit)  and have 300 armor. Also the ADC has 32% lifesteal.

The damage is reduced to 250 by your armor. 32% of that is 80 damage gained by the ADC. Grievous wounds cuts that in half: net +40 damage.

The new thornmail _doesn't have_ the 15% physical damage reflection. That reduces its damage by 150.

So you're giving up 150 extra damage per attack to prevent the ADC from healing 40 damage.

I repeat: It's a trap.

You're not wrong, but I still like the idea of the ADC having Grievous Wounds if you're zoning him and he's trying to lifesteal off of you. 

Also, in the case of a bruiser rocking Death's Dance etc., it's pretty reasonable to keep them occupied in melee while also making them vulnerable to getting focused down.
It's a bit much for one item damn and on that it's cheap and it will still only be used by rammus.
Not with health.  With health, practically every tank will use it.
The reason it has cold steel is so people are not as tempted to go and buy thornmail along with randuins. I'm still gonna buy the two though. 15% A/S slow is honestly garbage.
15% damage reduction for auto- based champions is garbage? How?
That's not how the stats nor math works.

1.0 Attack Speed

15% Attack Speed Slow lowers it to 0.85 Attack Speed

Assume 100 damage is dealt each attack

1.0 Attack Speed = 100 attacks over 100 seconds = 10,000 damage over 100 seconds

0.85 Attack Speed = 85 attacks over 100 seconds = 8,500 damage over 100 seconds

8,500 damage is 85% of 10,000 damage

Your damage has been reduced by 15%

GG, Atheists.

Lol. Here's Rammus math:

Assume 1000 damage is dealt with each attack. (A Crit-chance Ashe build, for instance) Rammus' 670 armor reduces that to 150 per attack.

Shooting Rammus deals 130 (from passive) + 275 (from current thornmail) damage per hit.

So in seven attacks, you're hitting me for 1050 damage, which I don't care about because I'm a tank, and I'm hitting you for 2835 damage, which will kill you.

Cold steel increases the time it takes for you to get killed by 15%. 

Do not want.

Yeah, but that's just Rammus. He can get a buff to his reflect damage as compensation, since he's the only tank who really _wants_ the enemy to attack him as much as possible (dang masochist). 

I don't know. I don't see a huge reason to have Cold Steel added, but I also don't see a huge reason that it _shouldn't _ have Cold Steel. I'd be fine either way.

As Rammus, you *want* people to AA you to deal as much damage as possible. I want those squishies to kill themselves as fast as they can. Cold steel gets in the way.

Also, the unique passive doesn't stack with other armor items like randuins and frozen heart, making it gold inefficient to stack armor. We don't need another cold steel item.
Frozen Heart is a different effect, which does stack with Randuin's/Thornmail's Cold Steel.
